Class InputHandler

java.lang.Object
parade.helpers.inputHandlers.InputHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
LineInputHandler, MenuInputHandler
public abstract class InputHandler extends Object
Abstract class representing an input handler for managing player input during the game. Subclasses can implement different styles of interaction, such as line input or menu-driven input.

  • Constructor Details

    • InputHandler

      public InputHandler(org.jline.terminal.Terminal terminal)
      Constructs an InputHandler with the provided terminal instance.
      Parameters:
      terminal - the terminal used for reading input and rendering output

  • Method Details

    • flush

      protected abstract void flush()
      Flushes any buffered output or input state. Called when a refresh or cleanup of the input handler is required.

    • turnSelect

      public abstract SelectionInput turnSelect(ParadeBoard paradeBoard, Player currentPlayer, String[] actionStrings) throws IOException
      Handles the player's selection during their turn.
      Parameters:
      paradeBoard - the current state of the parade board
      currentPlayer - the player making a selection
      actionStrings - the list of allowed action commands (e.g., "Change Input Type", "Exit Game")
      Returns:
      a SelectionInput representing the player's chosen input
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while reading input

    • startInput

      public abstract void startInput() throws IOException
      Starts the input handling session. Can be used to prepare the terminal or resources.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while starting input

    • stopInput

      public abstract void stopInput() throws IOException
      Stops the input handling session and cleans up any resources.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while stopping input
